Mercosur Visa for Chileans

Complete guide to obtaining the Mercosur Residency as a Chilean citizen. Specific requirements, timeline, and process for Chile passport holders.

Overview for Chilean Citizens

Mercosur Residency is available to citizens of Mercosur member and associate countries. This is the most advantageous residency option for qualifying nationals, offering streamlined processing and full work rights. As a Chilean citizen, you have visa-free entry to Argentina for 90 days that affect your pathway to this visa.

Special Considerations for Chileans:

  • â€¢You're eligible for the Mercosur residency pathway, which is the fastest and most affordable route to living in Argentina.

Is This Visa Right for You?

The Mercosur Visa is designed for:

  • Citizens of Mercosur full members (Argentina, Brazil, Paraguay, Uruguay, Bolivia)
  • Citizens of associate members (Chile, Peru, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Suriname)
  • EU citizens (through EU-Mercosur association)
  • Nationals of countries with Mercosur agreements

Requirements for Chileans

Additional Requirements

  • â€¢ Citizenship of qualifying country
  • â€¢ Valid passport or national ID
  • â€¢ Clean criminal record (requirements vary by nationality)
  • â€¢ Proof of address in Argentina
  • â€¢ Proof of means of support (flexible requirements)

Document Checklist for Chileans

As a Chilean citizen, you'll need these documents:

  • Valid passport or national ID
  • Criminal record check (if required for your nationality)
  • Birth certificate
  • Proof of address in Argentina
  • Passport photos
  • Criminal background check from Chile (apostilled) - Certificado de Antecedentes (from Registro Civil) with apostille. Required for residency.

Timeline & Process

Processing Time

15-30 days (fastest processing for Mercosur nationals)

Visa Duration

2 years for associates, permanent for full members

Path to Citizenship

After 2 years, can apply for citizenship

Step-by-Step Process

1

Entry to Argentina

Chileans can enter visa-free for 90 days. Use this time to prepare your application.

2

Gather Documents

Obtain all required documents from Chile. Note: Documents must be apostilled in Chile before travel.

3

Submit Application

Apply at the DirecciÃ³n Nacional de Migraciones (DNM) in Buenos Aires or your local migraciones office.

4

Receive Precaria

You'll receive a temporary authorization (precaria) allowing you to stay legally while processing.

5

Collect Residency Card

Once approved, collect your DNI (residency card) and enjoy your new life in Argentina!

Costs

Government Fee$100-300 USD
Legal Fees (optional)$300-1,000 USD (optional, process is straightforward)
Total Estimated Cost$400-1,300 USD

Pros & Cons

Advantages

  • +Fastest processing time
  • +Lowest cost
  • +Full work authorization immediately
  • +Simplified requirements
  • +Full members get immediate permanent residency
  • +Path to citizenship in 2 years

Considerations

  • â€¢Only available to qualifying nationalities
  • â€¢Must maintain Mercosur country citizenship

Frequently Asked Questions

What's the difference between full and associate member benefits?

Full members get immediate permanent residency. Associate members get 2-year temporary residency that can become permanent. Both have work authorization.

Can I apply if I have dual citizenship with a Mercosur country?

Yes, if you hold citizenship of a qualifying Mercosur country, you can apply under those provisions.
